intro: Varronia intonsa, commonly known as the white soursop, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The tree produces a large, spiny fruit that contains a soft, white, edible pulp with a sweet and sour flavor. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and for the medicinal properties of its leaves and fruit. The plant is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
